story.storykicker: While Deshpande's contribution to the world of performing arts is impossible to quantify, her passion and acting prowess are just few of the many things that the world will miss about her.
story.storybody:
Having made her mark in the fields of theatre, television and Bollywood alike, veteran actress Sulabha Deshpande is no longer amidst us.

The actress who was reportedly, 79 years of age passed away last night at her Mumbai residence due to a prolonged illness.

While Deshpande's contribution to the world of performing arts is impossible to quantify, her passion and acting prowess are just few of the many things that the world will miss about her.

Also Read: Veteran Hindi, Marathi actor Sulabha Deshpande passes away

One such person being actress Pallavi Joshi, who told IANS, "She was such a wonderful person I am so disturbed ever since I have heard this news. We have worked together a lot and I remember Alpviram was the longest serial we have done together."

Adding, Joshi also said "She was a motherly figure to me and it's certainly a great loss to the industry. I had spoken to her few months back over phone but she was not well for a while."

Also Read: Veteran comedian Razak Khan passes away

During her lifetime, the talented Sulabha Deshpande made it a point to not only write scripts for various plays but also act in several of them.

Deshpande was married to renowned theatre figure, Arvind Deshpande with whom she co-founded the theatre group Awishkar.
story.magazinekicker: While Deshpande's contribution to the world of performing arts is impossible to quantify, her passion and acting prowess are just few of the many things that the world will miss about her.
story.shortheadline: RIP Sulabha Deshpande: Was like a mother to me, huge loss to the industry, says actress Pallavi Joshi
